remarks: Two ways that ` A ` and ` B ` can "partition" ` C ` (when ` A ` and ` B ` don't overlap and ` A ` is a part of ` C ` ).  In classical logic, the second implication would be a biconditional.  (Contributed by Jim Kingdon, 4-Aug-2018.)
statement: uneqdifeqim $p |- ( ( A C_ C /\ ( A i^i B ) = (/) ) -> ( ( A u. B ) = C -> ( C \ A ) = B ) ) $.
